root_causes: Script enforces per-cell requiredness (flags missing cells) even though question attribute NotRequired = true (fields should be optional).
Arithmetic validation for B5ex5_3 is applied even when special codes (97/98/99) are present in any component — it does not exclude special codes from the sum-check.

Arithmetic validation may not behave correctly when component cells are missing (diff becomes system-missing); the script forces B5ex5_3 presence or flags an arithmetic error even if components are missing.
Precision requirement (Precision = 4) is not validated (no check on decimal precision), if that was intended.
instructions: Remove or change the missing-value error for visible columns: do not set cell_err = 1 for miss(cell). Instead only validate range/format when a response is present. In other words, change the requiredness check to only flag when not miss(cell) AND the value fails numeric/special-code checks.

Change the arithmetic check so it runs only when all three relevant cells are present and contain numeric responses (i.e., none of B5ex5_1, B5ex5_2, B5ex5_3 equal special codes 97/98/99 and none are system-missing). For example, require: b5col5_vis = 1 AND B5eDKx5 <> 1 AND not any(B5ex5_1,97,98,99) AND not any(B5ex5_2,97,98,99) AND not any(B5ex5_3,97,98,99) AND not miss(B5ex5_1) AND not miss(B5ex5_2) AND not miss(B5ex5_3) THEN check abs(B5ex5_3 - (B5ex5_1 + B5ex5_2)) > tolerance.

If the validation rule intends to require B5ex5_3 when the other two are provided, implement that explicitly: when b5col5_vis = 1 AND B5eDKx5 <> 1 AND not miss(B5ex5_1) AND not miss(B5ex5_2) AND not any(B5ex5_1,97,98,99) AND not any(B5ex5_2,97,98,99) THEN require not miss(B5ex5_3) (otherwise flag) and then check the numeric equality as above.

If decimal precision must be enforced (Precision = 4), add a check to ensure values do not exceed 4 decimal places (e.g., compare rounded(value,4) to value) for numeric entries that are not special codes.
Keep the existing logic that flags unexpected non-missing answers when the column is hidden or when DK is selected (cell_err = 2) — this is correct.
